questions.title: In the following sentences separate the subject and the predicate.:
questions.question: The cackling of geese saved Rome.

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: The crowd was very big.

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: Always speak the truth.

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: We all love honesty.

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: Our class consists of twenty pupils.

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: The elephant has great strength.

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: Solomon was famous for his wisdom.

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: Cleanliness is next to godliness.

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: We saw a fleet of ships in the harbour.
questions.description: fleet- Collective; ships- Common, harbour- Common

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: The class is studying grammar.

questions.title: Point out the Nouns in the following sentences, and say whether they are Common, Proper, Collective or Abstract:
questions.question: The Godavari overflows its banks every year.

questions.title: Tell which Pronouns in the following sentences are Reflexive and which Emphatic:
questions.question: I will go myself.

questions.title: Tell which Pronouns in the following sentences are Reflexive and which Emphatic:
questions.question: Rama has hurt himself.

questions.title: Tell which Pronouns in the following sentences are Reflexive and which Emphatic:
questions.question: We often deceive ourselves.

questions.title: Tell which Pronouns in the following sentences are Reflexive and which Emphatic:
questions.question: I myself heard the remark.

questions.title: Tell which Pronouns in the following sentences are Reflexive and which Emphatic:
questions.question: You express yourself very imperfectly.
